alert.note: Alert for Grand (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 12:22PM MDT until July 07 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Colorado, including the following county, Grand. This includes the eastern portion of the East Troublesome burn area. * WHEN...Until 145 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1222 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Up to 0.3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... East Inlet, Willow Creek, Onahu Creek, Trail Creek, Colorado River, Tonahutu Creek, Ranger Creek, Gold Run, North Inlet, Soda Creek and Echo Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grand Lake. - This includes the following additional locations... Rocky Mountain National Park west entrance, Green Mountain in Rocky Mountain National Park, North Inlet in Grand Lake, Columbine Lake, rising water in the Colorado River along River Rd, Lower Stillwater Creek and Stillwater Pass.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Heavy Rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the East Troublesome burn area. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows.
